intro: Kuhnia schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's kuhnia, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant features upright, slender stems that bear small, triangular leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, typically blooming in shades of white or pale pink. Kuhnia schaffneri is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
